title: Handle emails being cut off due to too small height value on scaler
description:
We've seen a class of bugs in rendering where emails, especially ones with lots of external images, load in the reading pane, but the entire bottom portion of the email is cut off.  Our current theory is that there is something wrong with how we are getting calls about images loading in the DOM, and we're calculating an incorrect height when putting our scaler element in the HTML to set the width properly.  To attempt to work around this, I've added a feature flag in the 2.24.8 email-renderer project to not set this height.  My initial testing has shown good results, so I want to get this in the hands of more people.

Some notes about the procedure for checking this in:

* Currently, the email-renderer project has not had the 2.24.8 version published yet, and the version available now is 2.24.8-SNAPSHOT.  Assuming that this PR looks good, I will publish the 2.24.8 official version, and then modify this PR to use that version, instead of the SNAPSHOT version.  Everything else should work the same, though.
* iOS will need to have a PR to update and use the 2.24.8 version as well as passing the new flag.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9> 

**Test Steps:**
This repros easiest on devices with large vertical resolutions in portrait mode.
1. Open a mail with lots of external internet images (for example, shopping/advertisement mails from online stores).
2. Verify that the whole email is rendered fully, without being cut off.

Some options that might be helpful in testing:
* Settings > Debug Actions > Internal data reset > Invalidate message render cache - Force message rendering to completely reset.
* Settings > Debug Actions > Performance > Pre-render messages: Turn on or off pre-rendering
* Settings > Debug Actions > Performance > Show message render time: Shows the internal data about how long rendering took, its render ID, and when we believe rendering is complete

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):**
* EMAIL_RENDERER_DONT_WRITE_HEIGHT_ON_SCALER - This is a pass through to the email renderer, where the code that uses this value is used.


**Todo:**
- [x] Before checkin of this PR, publish the email-renderer to 2.24.8 and update to use that official version, not the SNAPSHOT version.

title: Block & Enqueue Aria Analytics Logging for MIIT Builds
description:
**Requirement:** MIIT flavor of Outlook App requires no network calls to be initiated from the app until the user has provided her/his consent for the same (shown in `MittDisclaimerActivity`).

* In case of `AriaEventLogger` we're using the flag `BaseAnalyticsProvider.DISABLE_ANALYTICS` to disable/enable Logging.
* This flag is defaulted to `false` & set to `true` for MIIT once we inject dependencies via Dagger & call `AcompliApplication::initAnalytics()`
* During the time between `Application boot (onCreate)` to `initAnalytics`, there are around 6 Aria events being sent out, which shouldn't be happening in case of `MIIT` flavor

**Solution**
* Set default value of `DISABLE_ANALYTICS` based on Build Flavour
For Non-MIIT Flavor, this still remains `false`.
For MIIT Flavor, we set it to `true` blocking events by default
* In cases when Aria events are disabled, we enqueue the events & call `checkAndFlushPendingEvents` when User Provides consent for Network Calls

**Primary Reviewer:** @<4246CBD4-75DA-4F49-BEA5-8FC8D3DFEC4A> @<7D7DD458-24E1-6825-BD0E-4018B45CC218> 

**Test Steps:**

*Pre-Requisites:* 
* Setup & Connects Charles to monitor Network Calls originating from App with SSL Proxying Enabled
Reference: https://medium.com/@daptronic/the-android-emulator-and-charles-proxy-a-love-story-595c23484e02
OR
* Add Logs to AriaEventLogger to monitor the same


**MIIT Flavour:**  Build MIIT Flavour of App
1. One Time Consent
* Cold Start the App, User would be redirected to Consent Screen
* Monitor Charles or Logs, No calls should originate to Aria
* Press "Ok" to provide consent
* All Enqueued events should be sent out via Aria. Any new events should also be sent out via Aria
* Setup an account
* Kill the App & Start it again
* Aria calls should now be blocked & enqueued

2. No Consent
* Cold Start the App, User would be redirected to Consent Screen
* Monitor Charles or Logs, No calls should originate to Aria
* Press "Cancel" to decline consent
* No events should be sent out via Aria
* Launch App Again, Aria calls should now be blocked & enqueued

3. Permanent Consent
* Cold Start the App, User would be redirected to Consent Screen
* Monitor Charles or Logs, No calls should originate to Aria
* Select "Don't show again" & Press "Ok" to provide permanent consent
* All Enqueued events should be sent out via Aria. Any new events should also be sent out via Aria
* Setup an account
* Kill the App & Start it again
* Now all events should go to Aria directly & nothing should be enqueued.

**Mainline Flavour:**  Build Mainline Flavour of App
* Cold Start the App
* Monitor Charles or Logs
* All events should go to Aria directly & nothing should be blocked.

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: Change triggers for AppSessionManager tracking. Callers to make a decision about when to start tracking taking Miit into consideration
description:
As a chocking neck for the Miit build, where certain constraints are put in the app, like no connections at all, it is desired to not nickle and dime things in the app. 

A lot of work has been in the works for months to orchestrate things in the app and that led to have, *for a group of pieces of code that run during boot* a single place where we can hold them until we need to kick them. In this case, the AppSessionManager.

The idea is that when in Miit build, instead of starting the tracking of activities and such that drives the app session manager events, we can hold it until the user has consented. When the user has consented, the signal to app session manager can be kicked and things would move on with business as usual.

*** NOTE there are changes in this PR that not meant to be here, but needed to get things going. All the changes to VariantManager and VariantComponent will be coming from https://office.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Mobile/_git/client-android/pullrequest/307216?_a=overview

A tiny portion may either come from this PR or from here https://office.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Mobile/_git/client-android/pullrequest/302594?_a=overview (the piece where dagger object is kicked earlier than it was in the past)

**Primary Reviewer:** @<2108F300-2AB6-4F2F-BC9C-06B838BD629B> 

**Test Steps:**
logging tag to check whether things kicked or not: OlmAppSessionManager.
If any line of the events (app starting, app started, foreground change, component change and first activity) kicks in, something is wrong.

A)
Build Miit
Kick app
See the consent
Observe no app session manager events are kicked

B)
Build Miit
Kick app
See the consent
Observe no app session manager events are kicked
Accept the consent WITHOUT the checking the checkbox for "don't ask me again"
Observe all session manager events are kicked

C)
with A) and B), close the app and do it again

D) 
Build Miit
Kick app
See the consent
Observe no app session manager events are kicked
Accept the consent AND the checking the checkbox for "don't ask me again"
Observe all session manager events are kicked

E) 
with D), close the app
kick the app
observe all session manager events are kicked under regular order

F)
build any other build that is not Miit
kick the app
observe all session manager are kicked under regular order

**** for all the events above, consider doing them with and without accounts ****

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: Compose v2 > Fix invalid content-type format used for IMAP attachments
description:
When selecting attachments from IMAP accounts they have full content type ("type/subtype; name=xxx"), which can't be accepted by OkHttp (it only accepts "type/subtype"), which is used for uploading attachments with AC. To fix it we patch this upon receiving selected files in Compose v2, as well as when constructing attachment upload request with AC.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9> @<43C04179-FCDA-61C3-B0F6-A1DC2742566A> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Add IMAP account
2. Open compose, select file to attach via Choose from file, select a non inline file from IMAP account
3. Fill in recipient, subject and send
4. Message should be sent successfully

**Unit Tests Added:** Yes

**Feature Flag(s):** composeV2a

title: Add progress bar support in CollectionBottomDialog
description:
Spin off PR of !332947

For report message, I want to show some kind of progress when you click either "report spam" or "report phishing" since we make a network call. In !332947 I am making the network call in ```ReportMessageBottomSheetDialog```, which is a dialog fragment which includes a ```CollectionSheetBottomDialog```. Since I'm showing ```ReportMessageBottomSheetDialog``` in multiple places, I'd like to keep the logic for doing the network call and loading progress bar inside that class.

**Note**
I hide the recyclerview which shows the actions you can take while progress is loading so the user doesn't try to click again. 

**Primary Reviewer:** @<C45DB8BD-0245-414F-A31F-502A5044644E> 

**Test Steps:**
1. You actually want to test by pulling down the branch from !332947 which is already merged with this branch.
2. We only make network call for enterprise accounts. So make sure you're a HX enterprise account. That or just comment out code to force progress to show :)
3. Go to an email
4. Go to mail actions by clicking hamburger in conversation
5. Click "report message"
6. Click either report spam or report phishing
7. The progress bar shows until network call is done.
    - The network call may go through fast and you might not see progress bar. Either set a breakpoint or do Thread.sleep() if you want to see :)

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: Fixing issue where Intune Identity is not set properly for shared mailboxes
description:
We were not correctly enforcing Intune restrictions for Shared Mailboxes. Intune provides protection using the account's "identity" or UPN. Each time we change a view, we pass the identity to Intune, so Intune knows which account's content is in the view. If it's the managed identity, Intune provides restrictions.

In the case of Shared Mailboxes, they are not themselves managed, but the primary mailbox is. If the Shared Mailbox is on the UI, we should always provide Intune with the primary managed account's identity.

To do this, I moved the `getIntuneIdentity()` method that was on `ACMailAccount` to `ACAccountManager` so that when we request the Intune Identity for an account we can check if its a shared mailbox, and if so, return the identity of the primary account.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<DD00AE4A-A3DD-41F5-A90C-B296969B7312> 

###Test Steps:

**Setup:**
1. Add an Intune protected O365 account that has access to shared mailboxes (test account details below)
1. Add a shared mailbox

**Scenarios**
1. Pasting shared mailbox data to an unmanaged app is blocked
1. Pasting shared mailbox data to an unmanaged account within Outlook is blocked
1. Pasting shared mailbox data to the primary managed account is allowed
1. Shared mailbox can save attachments to personal/unmanaged storage accounts. This should be blocked (data leakage scenario).

**UPN:** `james@corp.rs4lab.com`
**Email:** `james@rs4lab.com`
**Password:** `Lab1Pwd99!`
**Shared mailboxes:** `marketing@rs4lab.com` / `sales@rs4lab.com`

title: During BootOrchestrator, some "leaf" components are needed as dependencies for the next level in the work items. First one needed: VariantManager
description:
For Sony work, a need that raised was to have VariantManager available early in the boot. Since some of the items it depends come from the Miit module, other techniques like using a factory like method can't work. 

That lead to one of the things that were originally discussed in the early days of orchestrating boot. That was that as the different levels of Boot components were created, some injection would take place (smaller than the one in AcompliApplication).

Well, the day has come. Right now, VariantManager is not used, but it will be used in several PRs that are in the works that need this. Hence doing one little thing here.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<4918FDFC-93AE-448C-B655-1A83522F80D2> 

**Test Steps:**
To make your life easier, add a line of code right after the injection of the new type takes place, something like
Log.d("CHECKTHISOUT", String.format("VariantManager.shouldBlockNetworkAccess() %b", l1BootComponentsInjector.mVariantManager.shouldBlockNetworkAccess()));
Run the app in both Miit and regular.
Observe that the value is false in regular build and true in Miit build.

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: Files > Add SharePoint entries and SharePoint browser/picker
description:
Add entries for SharePoint to new file landing page, under corresponding O365 or OD4B accounts. Tapping on these entries, or See more under relevant account should launch browser/picker for relevant SharePoint site. All browsing/picking functionalities should work similarly to other file providers. No search support at the moment.

SharePoint hierarchy is structured as follows:
```
SP site(s)
|_ SP library(ies)
   |_ SP document(s) - either a file, or a directory
      |_ SP document(s)
```
Navigating a hierarchy level may require hitting a different API host, which is determined from the response of the API call for the previous hierarchy level. For each API call, we rely on ADAL library to acquire token for the given host. It should either retrieve from cache, or do a fresh acquisition if no such token exists or is already expired.

Response cache is supported for fetching SP sites and libraries, which are less likely to change. We always do a fresh fetch for SP documents, similar to how we navigate other file providers. SP file downloads are cacheable as well.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Turn on Combined file picker flag
2. Add an O365/OD4B account (username: meganb@M365x921038.onmicrosoft.com, password x50aQn5X5S)
3. Open search tab, tap on Files
4. Should see at most 2 SharePoint entries under added O365/OD4B account, tapping them should open SharePoint site browser
5. Should see See more under SharePoint entries in landing page, tapping it should open SharePoint landing page, listing Frequent and Followed sites

**Unit Tests Added:** Yes

**Feature Flag(s):** Combined file picker

title: Remove Permanent Consent Checkbox from MIIT Flavour
description:
As part of Sony MIIT Partner release after consenting with CELA Team, we've taken a call to remove the Checkbox that reads "Don't show again" as part of MIIT Disclaimer Screen.

Going forward pressing "Ok" once would amount to a Permanent Consent for network access.
Behavior in case of "Cancel" remains the same.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<7D7DD458-24E1-6825-BD0E-4018B45CC218> @<4246CBD4-75DA-4F49-BEA5-8FC8D3DFEC4A> 

**Test Steps:**
* Fresh Install Application
* Launch Application
* MIIT Disclaimer Screen would be shown
* Checkbox should no longer be shown
* Press "Cancel"
* Kill the App & relaunch again
* MIIT Disclaimer Screen would be shown always as long as the user keeps pressing Cancel
* Kill & Relaunch App, Press "Ok"
* MIIT Disclaimer screen should No longer be shown after the user presses "Ok" once.

**Screenshots:** [Remove this section if n/a]
|Before|After|
|---|---|
|![before.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/312580/attachments/before.png)|![after.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/312580/attachments/after.png)|

title: Set Tooltip reference to null when dismiss
description:
Multi memory leak happen to TeachingMomentsManager.

**Leak Analysis:**

```
├─ com.microsoft.intune.mam.client.app.ActivityLifecycleMonitor
│    Leaking: NO (CentralActivity↓ is not leaking)
│    ↓ ActivityLifecycleMonitor.mForegroundActivity
├─ com.acompli.acompli.CentralActivity
│    Leaking: NO (Activity#mDestroyed is false)
│    ↓ CentralActivity.mTeachingMomentsManager
│                      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
├─ com.acompli.acompli.teach.TeachingMomentsManager
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    ↓ TeachingMomentsManager.mTooltip
│                             ~~~~~~~~
├─ com.microsoft.office.outlook.uikit.widget.Tooltip
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    ↓ Tooltip.mContext
│              ~~~~~~~~
╰→ com.acompli.acompli.CentralActivity
​     Leaking: YES (Activity#mDestroyed is true and ObjectWatcher was watching this)
​     key = e522bd73-5b37-47fe-9ef1-9b7ee49e06aa
​     watchDurationMillis = 5421
​     retainedDurationMillis = 420
, retainedHeapByteSize=1101514)
```

 ```
├─ com.microsoft.intune.mam.client.app.ActivityLifecycleMonitor
│    Leaking: NO (CentralActivity↓ is not leaking)
│    ↓ ActivityLifecycleMonitor.mForegroundActivity
├─ com.acompli.acompli.CentralActivity
│    Leaking: NO (Activity#mDestroyed is false)
│    ↓ CentralActivity.mTeachingMomentsManager
│                      ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
├─ com.acompli.acompli.teach.TeachingMomentsManager
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    ↓ TeachingMomentsManager.mTooltip
│                             ~~~~~~~~
├─ com.microsoft.office.outlook.uikit.widget.Tooltip
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    ↓ Tooltip.mBuilder
│              ~~~~~~~~
├─ com.microsoft.office.outlook.uikit.widget.Tooltip$Builder
│    Leaking: UNKNOWN
│    ↓ Tooltip$Builder.anchorView
│                      ~~~~~~~~~~
├─ com.acompli.acompli.ui.drawer.view.AddButton
│    Leaking: YES (View.mContext references a destroyed activity)
│    mContext instance of com.acompli.acompli.CentralActivity with mDestroyed = true
│    View#mParent is set
│    View#mAttachInfo is null (view detached)
│    View.mWindowAttachCount = 1
│    ↓ AddButton.mListenerInfo
├─ android.view.View$ListenerInfo
│    Leaking: YES (AddButton↑ is leaking)
│    ↓ View$ListenerInfo.mOnClickListener
├─ com.acompli.acompli.ui.drawer.CalendarDrawerFragment_ViewBinding$1
│    Leaking: YES (View$ListenerInfo↑ is leaking)
│    Anonymous subclass of butterknife.internal.DebouncingOnClickListener
│    ↓ CalendarDrawerFragment_ViewBinding$1.val$target
╰→ com.acompli.acompli.ui.drawer.CalendarDrawerFragment
​     Leaking: YES (CalendarDrawerFragment_ViewBinding$1↑ is leaking and Fragment#mFragmentManager is null and ObjectWatcher was watching this)
​     key = 5d969d41-c64c-4c9b-be68-42eed92bc48b
​     watchDurationMillis = 5415
​     retainedDurationMillis = 412
, retainedHeapByteSize=4804)
```
**Cause:** 

Singleton class `TeachingMomentsManager` has a reference chain to a `Context` object through `TeachingMomentsManager.mTooltip.mContext` and to a `View` through `TeachingMomentsManager.mTooltip.mBuilder.ancherView` .

**Change:**
1. Set `TeachingMomentsManager.mTooltip`  to `null` when dismiss.
2. Use weak reference for the HashSet `TeachingMomentsManager.mOnMomentDismissListeners` which stores a reference to the activity.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<7086942D-435F-4EAA-A81E-FA5627BD9484> @<0AB917BA-D1F4-4FA6-B17F-8048E863E4FB> @<B2A688F8-E167-6014-882F-173439DAFB89> 

**Test Steps:**
- Step 1 Install LeakCanary tool by adding this line to Acompli:build.gradle
    debugImplementation 'com.squareup.leakcanary:leakcanary-android:2.0-beta-3'
- Step 2 Debug actions -> Discovery notifications -> Clear Teaching Moments preferences
- Step 3 Open a message or open Calendar menu, when tooltip show up, click outside to dismiss it.
- Step 4 Force GC until the LeakCanary begins heap dumping. Observe there should not be memory lead caused by `TeachingMomentsManager`

title: Refactor CrashHelper to make it controllable from CrashReportManager
description:
This PR is about refactoring crash reporting which will help in migrating to AppCenter later. Currently, We have CrashHelper which takes care of reporting hockey crashes. I've renamed it to HockeyCrashReportManager to make it readable. I've also created an Interface CrashReportManager which has all the methods which might be needed for AppCenterCrashReport as well. OMCrashReportManager is the implementation class which will delegate the crash reporting to either Hockey or AppCenter based on flight. As of now it's a fat interface, I will refactor that at later point when things will become more obvious and would easy to decide whether we need those methods as part of interface or not.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<AB4C2AF1-97A6-456D-9EB8-42DE8617DE16> @<4246CBD4-75DA-4F49-BEA5-8FC8D3DFEC4A> 

**Test Steps:**
1. `Debug Action --> Crash Control` should report crashes to Hockey.

**Unit Tests Added:** No.

* PowerLift Crash Descriptions

title: Attempt to email attendees of a meeting breaks draft scenario
description:
**Performance issue:**
we create async task for every attendee to add it, every task is handled in main thread in the end and it only cost about 20~30ms, but hundreds of attendees will make UI freezing.

**Deadlock:**

https://office.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Mobile/_workitems/edit/3643475/

Task in`UI_RESULTS_EXECUTOR` wait for another sub-task in `UI_RESULTS_EXECUTOR` completion, but the sub-task has no chance to be executed because all the executor threads are in waitting.

All the query tasks are waiting until 3 seconds timeout. If there have 300 attendees, it need wait for 300 * 3s / 4 threads = **3.75 minutes**, during that time **all the tasks using UI_RESULTS_EXECUTOR will be in waiting state**.
![image.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/339495/attachments/image.png) 

This PR improves performance by following cases:
 - Batch add the recipients
 - Build spannable in background thread
 - Call `TextView#setText()` instead of `Editable#append()` to add span when we replace all attendees

Using batch operation should greatly reduce the deadlock.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<A4EA5658-F035-6C6F-94ED-709181CA75A4> @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9>  @<F208FD84-CBC3-43B9-8FBB-180ABEAAC5DA> @<43C04179-FCDA-61C3-B0F6-A1DC2742566A> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Select an event in Calendar that contains hundreds of attendees(The more the better)
2. Click "EMAIL ATTENDEES"
3. Click "Everyone"

Compose V1: The to field cannot be auto-filled, and cannot view an event(the screen will be empty with white color)
Compose V2: UI is freeze

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Relate PR:**
!331862

**Todo:**
There still contain some issues when the amount in To/CC/BCC count is too large 
 - Creating **ViewSpan** costs too much time, one costs only 2~5ms, but hundreds of them will cost a long time, I move these operations to background thread as a workaround, but it can be optimized: 
   - Using Drawable instead of View
   - Only create when it can be shown. 
 - The arrow button to expand/collapse ContactPickerView doesn't work when a large amount of contacts
 - The `onSpanAdded()` callback does not support batch operation
 - Can we reduce the subtask? There have many nest task layer, I think it will improve the query performance if we can reduce the nest layer.
 - Should we show a progress bar dialog to prevent the user's interaction before the large count attendees are loaded

title: SMIME: Decrypt Reference Message (if needed) before CreateDraft is called
description:
Most of the times, When replying to SMIME message, the reference message is already decoded. But, there can be scenarios where the Reference message is not already decoded. For example - Replying from Notification or replying from reading pane before decrypting. If the reference message is not decoded, then the HxCore fails Draft Creation. Hence, before creating draft we must ensure that the reference message is decoded (in case of non-SMIME, we shouldnt do anything extra).

**Primary Reviewer:** @<986CA9FA-79CD-65D1-87E6-19C5EF3A4E90> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Setup SMIME accounts properly.
2. Send a Encrypted message to your account.
3. Wait for the notification to arrive, and click on Reply from Notification.
4. The app should not crash and it should expand the reference message automatically.

**Unit Tests Added:** YES

**Feature Flag(s):** [Remove this section if n/a]

title: Add support for background account creation
description:
AT&T has its own out of the box flow to add user accounts. You can also trigger the app later on to add accounts.

The way it works is that AT&T app does a check of the credentials first (yes) and then delegates to us (if we're installed) or the Samsung email app (default).

Under the hood it's pretty primitive, we either have IMAP, POP3 or EAS accounts. We'll do our best to connect those accounts but if we fail, we'll create an OS notification which will indicate to the user that we failed to connect the account (event though the AT&T app says otherwise...). The user will then have the choice of either `DELETE` the non connected account (which does nothing in our case except dismissing the notification) or `RETRY` which will trigger our AddAccount flow using AutoDetect.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<D8100E5C-30B5-692D-B3DA-89448A4D57EE> @<2108F300-2AB6-4F2F-BC9C-06B838BD629B> @<84043D56-522F-4554-AF3D-ADD955DB8CCE> 

**Test Steps:**

Download and install a modified version of the AT&T app here: https://microsoft-my.sharepoint-df.com/:u:/p/arvall/EY7EHGfZvaxDu8-OeF4S4M8BRWdrV2MVx9fcl8Q29W9HkA?e=OItcYz

Because of the modified version of the AT&T app, it does not match 100% the code change I'm submitting... Here's a patch to apply: https://ghe-us.microsoft.com/gist/arvall/1bb4c462ef4c18eefc98ac519f3c3190

The above patch allows you to select the `mainlineProdDebug` variant and use an `IntentService` instead of a `BroadcastReceiver` to jump start a `JotIntentService`.

1. Build & Run
2. Start Outlook
3. Start AT&T app (Don't kill Outlook)

Then you can test success flow using the following credentials and the `Other` type of account + POP3:
- email address: test.john.smith@outlook.com
- username: test.john.smith@outlook.com
- password: Outlook4life
- incoming server: outlook.office365.com
- incoming security: SSL (Trust all certificates)
- incoming port: 995
- outgoing server: smtp.office365.com
- outgoing security: SSL (Trust all certificates)
- outgoing port: 587

You can also test the failure case using the following credentials and the `Microsoft Exchange` type of account:
- email address: user1@exchange.dchdc.net
- username: user1
- password: Testing1
- domain: chden
- security: SSL (Trust all certificates)

(Tapping on DELETE should just dismiss the notification, tapping on RETRY should trigger the AddAccount flow)

**Feature Flag(s):** [Remove this section if n/a]
* CARRIER_ATT_CREATION_SERVICE (but with the patch from above, it's already forced ON)

title: Disable Quick Reply for SMIME messages
description:
SMIME does not support Quick Reply, i.e. user cannot reply to a message using quick reply. In case of SMIME, when user clicks on the quick reply bar, we show the Repl/Reply-All/Forward options to the user instead. When user clicks on any of these options, we open full compose. This is in Sync with how iOS is handling SMIME with quick Reply


**Primary Reviewer:** @<986CA9FA-79CD-65D1-87E6-19C5EF3A4E90> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Set up SMIME account properly.
2. Open a SMIME message, click on the quick reply bar. It should show the Reply options. Alternatively, click on the left icon to open the reply options. That should also show the Reply options.
3. Clicking on the reply options, should open up full compose.
4. For NON-SMIME messages, things should work as usual (very important to test this).

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):** 
* SMIME prototype master

title: minimize number of recipients for validation call after fetch
description:
For fetching recipient certificate and validating status of Certificates is done in two different ways by HxCore.
For the server calls the cert fetched is also validated, hence we can rely on it's status. But for the locally fetched certs we will need to fetch validation status. Currently validate all status after fetch call.
With this PR we will only fetch if status is not already valid.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<4B221264-CEBF-6B03-891B-9330C34EEF94> 

**Test Steps:**
1. open compose.
2. sign & encrypt.
3. Add few recipients.some should have cert some should not have certs.
4. when send mail it should show the pop up properly.
5. when all recipients are invalid - no cert popup should come.
6. When all recipient are with valid cert - no popup should come and mail should be sent.

**Unit Tests Added:** <Yes>

title: Local calendar write > default attendee type
description:
Google calendar writes the default attendee request type as `TYPE_REQUIRED`. We were writing `TYPE_OPTIONAL` as the default, but we should write `TYPE_REQUIRED` as the default for parity.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EF490E68-9367-6FD6-866C-38B37516F84F> @<2108F300-2AB6-4F2F-BC9C-06B838BD629B> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Create a local calendar event from outlook
2. Look at the event from the sidekick app
3. Look at the attendees table from the sidekick app, and look at the attendee corresponding to that event ID
4. Verify that the `attendeeType` is `1 (TYPE_REQUIRED)`

**Unit Tests Added:** Yes (updated)

**Feature Flag(s):**
* Local calendar write

title: Fix non module imports

title: Local calendars write > Fixing all day recurring event write
description:
For writing local events - the local calendar stack writes the event exception to the wrong day (the day before) if it is an all day recurring event exception, this PR fixes this by undoing the change that changes the date for Hx/AC stacks, and also making the read consistent for both `EventOccurrence` and `Event` objects

**Note** that there is a fundamental difference between how outlook handles all day events and how the android calendar handles all day events:
- outlook:
  - allDay = true
  - startTime = 12am UTC
  - endTime = startTime
- android:
  - allDay = true
  - startTime = 12am UTC
  - endTime = startTime + 1 day (12am UTC)

This was causing a bug where all day events weren't displayed correctly for local events. This bug is also fixed in this PR.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<2108F300-2AB6-4F2F-BC9C-06B838BD629B> 

**Test Steps:**
1. create a recurring series of all-day events
2. attempt to create an exception of an event in the series (change the title or some field other than the date/time)
3. verify that the exception is saved correctly and viewed correctly via the sidekick app and the google calendar app
4. Do the same with non-allday series
5. Do the same with non-recurring all day events
6. Same for non-recurring non-allday events

Also to test all day end:
1. go to draft event activity by clicking the create new event button
2. toggle the all day switch to on
3. verify that the duration is shown as "1 day"
4. save the event and view the event - verify that the duration is "1 day" and the start/end times are correct
5. repeat for all other stacks

**Unit Tests Added:** yes

**Feature Flag(s):** 
* Local calendar write

title: Add 3S bookmark answer to search
description:
This PR adds support for the bookmark answer in search. To do that, we need to add a temporary substrate client to talk to 3S directly to get the answer when Hx is not ready. And we need a new Auth resource to get the token to call 3S API for answer.

**Changes:**
1. Add a new Auth resource to retrieve token for 3S API
2. Add a temporary HTTP client to call 3S API directly
3. Integrate bookmark answer card to the search UI behind feature flag

**Primary reviewers:** 
@<09950D56-B98F-4EC7-BAFE-CB42AC4E8626> @<D8100E5C-30B5-692D-B3DA-89448A4D57EE>

3. Search for "hrweb" or "onboarding"

title: Split AcompliKit Tests into Hosted Non-Hosted targets.
description:
I made AcompliKit un-hosted and removed files till it built and tested successfully. 

Then duplicated the test target and added the de-targeted files to the new duplicate target. 

Running the accompli kit test scheme now only runs the non hosted tests and no longer builds the whole Outlook app.

To run accompli kit _Hosted_ tests run the new target scheme explicitly (its shared) or run the whole Outlook-iOS test Suite (both will make sure Outlook-iOS is built.

title: Fixes tapping on a searched file opening UI for compose
description:
In the new file picker, if you search for a file and then tap it, we show a bottom sheet relating to compose. This change makes sure we preview the file when you tap on it.

2. Navigate to the search tab
3. Navigate to files
4. Tap the search icon in the top right

title: fix context description
description:
AccountPickerView has supports two different adapters - ToolbarAccountAdapter which displays email address as title and account name as subtitle and ContentAccountAdapter which does the opposite. So, when we include ALL_ACCOUNT_ID with ToolbarAccountAdapter we populate the email address with all_accounts_name and when we include ALL_ACCOUNT_ID with ContentAccountAdapter we populate the account name with all_accounts_name.

However getContentDescription is expecting to find the ALL_ACCOUNT_ID in the display name. Instead of hard-coding this, we should just look first for the email address and then for the display name and use the first one we can find as the description.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<D8100E5C-30B5-692D-B3DA-89448A4D57EE> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Add multiple accounts to the app.
2. Turn on talkback.
3. Navigate to the 'Search 'tab item and activate it
4. Navigate to the search edit field and activate it
5. Navigate on to the account dropdown and listen to the announcement

Nearby cases include
1. The announcement of the account dropdown when an individual account is selected
2. The announcement of the account dropdown in the do not disturb settings (requires turning on the "do not disturb refresh" and rebooting the app) both with all accounts selected and an individual account selected.

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: AccountReauthManager: handle reauth for Hx Gmail CC account
description:
Handle reauth flow for Hx Gmail CC account.

Re-auth flow:
1. Account is set to offlineUserAttentionRequired
2. `HxTokenManager.refreshToken` calls the delegate method `reauthAccount`
3. `AccountReauthManager.handleReauthForGoogle` is called
4. Show prompt for user
5. User taps on prompt and it brings up the `GoogleAuthController`
6. Normal gmail sign in flow
7. Get refresh token and use it to update `HxAccount`'s refresh token through `ActorAPI.updateAccountCredentials`

Testing:
1. Turn on `HxGoogleCloudCache` feature flag
2. Add Hx gmail account
3. Go to settings -> debug action -> tokens -> invalidate hxcore token
4. Tap on invalidate hxcore token, turn off wifi, turn on wifi
5. Go back to message list and tap on status bar

title: ProviderEligibilityUtility: Handle migration between Hx and AC gmail CC
description:
Handle migration between Hx and AC gmail cloud cache accounts.

##Feature Flags
Added 3 new feature flags: `addNewGoogleCloudCacheAsHx`, `migrateACGoogleCloudCacheToHx`, `migrateHxGoogleCloudCacheToAC`.

`addNewGoogleCloudCacheAsHx` controls account creation. If this feature flag is on, we will add the account as Hx gmail cc account.

`migrateACGoogleCloudCacheToHx` controls account creation and migration. If this feature flag is on, we will add the account as Hx gmail cc account and migrate AC gmail cc account to Hx. This migration occurs every 3 days.

`migrateHxGoogleCloudCacheToAC` controls account migration. If this feature flag is on, we will migrate all Hx gmail cc account to AC gmail cc account.

##Flow
Create account flow:
1. User adds gmail account
2. Auto-detect figures out it is gmail
3. Check `ProviderEligibilityUtility.shared.shouldAddNewAccountAsHx`
4. If feature flag is on, add account as Hx gmail cc

Migration:
1. App boots up
2. Check `AutoProviderMigrationUtility.autoMigrateProviderTypesIfNeeded`
3. Get accounts to migrate in `AutoProviderMigrationUtility.accountsToMigrate`
4. If the auto migrate to AC feature flag is on, get only the Hx accounts to migrate back to AC else if the auto migrate to Hx feature flag is on, get the eligible Hx accounts (see check in `AutoPrivderMigrationUtility.shouldAutoMigrate(account: toProviderType`)
5. Add the new accounts
6. Delete the old accounts

##Testing
Testing migrating to Hx:
1. Make sure `HxGoogleCloudCache` feature flag is on
2. Add AC gmail CC account
3. Go to settings -> account settings
4. Toggle "Migrate to Hx"
5. Should see account migrated to Hx 

Testing migrating to AC:
1. Make sure `HxGoogleCloudCache` feature flag is on
2. Add Hx gmail CC account
3. Go to settings -> account settings
4. Toggle "Migrate to Hx"
5. Should see account migrated to AC
6. Will need to re-auth since we don't send the shadow tokens to AC (this will be changed in another PR if this is important enough).

Creating new account:
1. Turn on `addNewGoogleCloudCacheAsHx` or `migrateACGoogleCloudCacheToHx`
2. Add new gmail account
3. New gmail account should be Hx
4. Repeat except in the account type picker (add random account, tap on "Not Exchange", etc button at top right corner)
5. Will have to re-auth since we don't send the shadow tokens to AC

Migrating account on boot
1. Add AC gmail account
2. Turn on `migrateACGoogleCloudCacheToHx` and turn off `disableHxAutoMigration`
3. Restart the app (might need to comment out the check against `AutoProviderMigratioNutility.timeBetweenAutoMigration`)

title: Fix search suggestions in compose for Generic IMAP
description:
For Hx IMAP Direct and Hx IMAP CC,  when we try to compose an email and send it to a person to whom we have sent an email previously, their name or email don't show up in suggestions when you type their email address in email field during composing.

**Problem:** `HxAccountManager.shared.hxAccount(with: .people)` for generic IMAP was actually returning an empty array of hxAccounts when we call `searchLocalContacts`. Because of this, we exit early and we never get any suggestions

**Solution:**  Capability people searches if `HxAccountDataType` of the account contains `contacts` which generic IMAP doesn't support/contain. For generic IMAP we make sure we check if `HxAccountDataType` of the account contains `mail` instead of `contacts`

title: BugFix: fix combined search keyword highlight UILabel multiline issue
description:
This PR is a workaround to fix the issue that message cell in search tab will not line break when there is a background highlight. 

The only way to solve this issue now is to eliminate the 1.5 points line-spacing in the label (that's the spacing between the first and second line of the body). This will only affect message cells in search tab but not the mail tab cells. The spacing is too subtle to tell the difference.

### Changes
- Set line-spacing=0 for attributedString in search tab

title: Updating the app manifest with some Samsung requests
description:
Samsung is getting reports that notifications are not showing up on the Gear S3 for some users. They narrowed the issue down to a permission that they claim is not needed (but is mentioned as needed in their SDK documentation...). 

Additionally, there is a claim that some watch/phone combinations are getting duplicate notifications. They claim the fix for this is a meta-data entry for their watch manager application, so that it doesn't send a duplicate notification for the app, but instead lets the app send the notification alone. 

**Primary Reviewer:** @<AB4C2AF1-97A6-456D-9EB8-42DE8617DE16> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Start the phone app and login with an account
2. Pair the phone with a Samsung watch
3. Install the tizen watch Outlook app and sync the wearable app with the phone app (just launching it should suffice)
4. Send an email to the account that is logged in on the phone
5. Verify that one and only one notification shows on the watch.
**NB: May need to specifically use a Gear S3 with a Note10.**

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Todo:** 
- [ ] Verify on an actual Gear S3

title: Files > Add preview option, remove choose from device files
description:
Since new file picker adds an option to navigate local files, that option should now be removed from compose attach popup. Also add a preview option when selecting an eligible file to attach. An eligible file for preview is a file that can be opened by Outlook and not an external app:
- images: Outlook image viewer
- PDF: Outlook PDF viewer, if the flag is on
- WXP: Outlook WXP viewer, only for Hx attachments, if the flag is on

3. Tap Choose from files, navigate and select an eligible file for preview: should see a popup with at least 2 options: Attach and Preview
4. Tap Preview: should open the file inside Outlook
5. Navigate and select a non-eligible file for preview: should either attach it directly, or see a popup without Preview option

title: Files > Use Graph API and SP direct API for OneDrive business
description:
Create new OneDriveBusinessFileManager to handle OneDrive for business file logic:
- recent files/search results should come from Graph API
- directory listing should come from SharePoint direct API (this requires root site discovery, which is now added as part of OneDriveForBusinessTokenUpdateStrategy)

Depends on which API a file comes from, subsequent actions for it will use that API.

With SharePoint API logic and OneDrive Graph API logic already available in existing FileManagers (SharePointFileManager and OneDriveConsumerFileManager), the job of OneDriveBusinessManager now is to simply delegate to these 2.

OneDriveConsumerFileManager is now renamed to OneDriveGraphFileManager, and made generic to handle both MSA and AAD account (the only difference is in the way we fetch token). 

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Turn on Combined file picker feature flag
2. Add OneDrive for Business account
3. Open search tab, Files
4. Should see recent OneDrive fo Business files if any
5. Should see Files under OneDrive for Business/O365 account, tapping on it should navigate OneDrive for Business hierarchy
6. Tap on a OneDrive for Business file should download/save it

**Unit Tests Added:** Yes

**Feature Flag(s):** Combined file picker

title: Suggested reply: Accessibility
description:
This PR is to integrate voice over support on suggested reply.

**Requirement description from ticket:**
> - After reading the contents of the last email in the conversation, user should be able to swipe through smart reply options in the format "X of Y [ suggestion ], button". Ex: "two of three, Yes, I'll be there, button."
> - Before the FIRST option, read "Suggested replies:"
> - After the last option, user should swipe to quick reply modality button.
> - If the user double taps on a suggested reply, focus should go to the quick reply box. Current content of the QRB should be read aloud after the words "Message body," and the cursor should be placed at the end of the suggested reply.

**Test steps:**

- Receive a email with content of "Thank you for your email!"
- Notice there're suggested replies at end of thread
- Turn on Voice Over.

title: 3671646 AvatarManager > Wipe out all entries
description:
This introduce a very simple mechanism to wipe out all entries of the avatar cache (including HxCore entries) based on a version of the cache, each time we increment the AVATAR_CACHE_VERSION constant, it will drop all cache entries.

Worth noting that this is a very bad way of doing the eviction of all entries because it's happening when we instantiate AvatarManager, so there is potentially a penality happening on the UiThread. Because of the time constraint of this being needed right away to fix an avatar problem, this is the best way of doing it, and a time one penality too.

In the future, HxCore will provide a way for us to know that a clear of the cache entries is needed.

Also, not touching the lifetime of our entries in the OkHttpCache yet, but that's something that is being discussed with HxCore and other platforms too.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<840FC68B-4B25-683C-8C34-EC9A98282876> @<09950D56-B98F-4EC7-BAFE-CB42AC4E8626> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Build & Run

=> You should see in the logcat, something like the following. You can also browse the files on the device and check the content of `cache/avatars` and `files/Files/S0/[account_folders]/Photos` and see that it's either now empty or contains fresh entries.

```
09-27 10:06:47.363 10175 10175 I AvatarManager: Clearing avatars cache...
09-27 10:06:47.397 10175 10175 I AvatarManager: Avatar cache cleared!
```

title: SMIME Compose can work in certain scenarios even if SMIME Settings if OFF
description:
In the Compose Code at most of the places we have been checking for isSmimeEnabledForAccount, which apart from check the FF also checks if the SMIME settings for the account is turned on. 
However, after discussion with HxCore folks and PM, it was decided that under some circumstances even if the settings is OFF, the user can edit SMIME drafts.  For example - If the user is replying to a signed message then we should allow the user to reply if SMIME feature flag is turned on. Also, if Auto Sign and Encrypt of draft is enabled (by Exchange EAS policies, then we should allow). 

We use isSmimeEnabledForAccount only for few cases now - 

1. The user cannot manually create a SMIME draft or edit a Draft that has SMIME auto enabled (for example - replying to SMIME message) if SMIME settings is OFF>
2. We should not attempt decryption of SignedOnOpague type of SMIME messages (these are mostly encrypted), if the SMIME settings is OFF.

So instead of isSmimeEnabledForAccount we use isSmimeEnabled at most places.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<986CA9FA-79CD-65D1-87E6-19C5EF3A4E90> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Enable SMIME feature flag.
2. Send a signed message from some other account.
3. Open the signed message and reply to it. 
4. User should be able to reply to the message

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):** 
SMIME prototype master

title: Signed messages must be rendendered properly even if SMIME settings is OFF, but
description:
Previously if SMIME settings was OFF and we fetched full body of a signed message, we used to show "This message is signed" text instead of the real body. In case of a thread conversation with more than one message, we used to get the Trimmed body from MessageData and we didnt decode the SMIME payload. However, we need to download and decode the SMIME payload for proper rendering (which includes attachment). Also, since SMIME messages take time to load, similar to FullBody rendering we show a loader while the message is decoded. 

**Primary Reviewer:** @<986CA9FA-79CD-65D1-87E6-19C5EF3A4E90> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Enable SMIME FF.
2. Send a signed message from other accounts. Reply to the signed message from some other client to create a thread.
3. Open the signed message in our app.

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):**
Smime Prototype master

title: Remove Webview Container when full body is being loaded
description:
SMIME Messages can take long time to load. Hence, we show a loader in the reading pane when the message is being fetched. However, above the loader we have lot of white space which does not look great. This PR attempts to fix this. When the loading is in progress we remove the Webview container and once loading is complete we bring it back.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9> 

**Test Steps:**
- Login with hxsmime-1@hxsmimetest.onmicrosoft.com  Password: T%nt0wn!
- Enable SMIME Feature Flag. Restart
- Go the the Account Settings Page -> Security -> Enable SMIME -> This will restart the app.
- Go to Search Zero Query -> Files -> One drive account for the account -> Click on PFX file -> Password 123 -> Enter alias (default OutlookMobile) -> Select the Alias in the previous step -> Cert install complete.
- Compose -> Add yourself as recipient. Add a large video file (around 2 MB) -> Click on ... overflow -> Sign/Encrypt -> Select Encrypt -> Banner appears in Compose -> Send.
- Open the received mail. You will see a loader while the message is fetched.

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):** 
Smime prototype master

title: MarkupTextView: Fix text color while changing theme
description:
- Separate evaluation and user script
  - While the view is initializing, use `WKUserScript`
  - While theme is changing, use `evaluateJavaScript`
- Extract the js script to `textStyleScript`

### Motivation

Reference: https://stackoverflow.com/a/41870201

> 2.3.2 Inject javascript from native code to js DOM emphasized text WKUserContentController allows add (and remove) a WKUserScript to be injected either when the DOM tree starts to load or finishes to load. On the contrary, evaluateJavaScript allows application to execute a javascript snippet on demand at any time.

### Visual check

| DEV  | THIS PR |
 | ---- | ------- |

title: GoogleAuthController: add PUID to credentials so that account_lifecycle has PUID for gmail CC
description:
Add PUID to credentials so that account_lifecycle has PUID for gmail CC.

Gmail CC accounts did not have its PUID property set which makes it hard to track the telemetry event account_lifecycle. For Gmail CC, the PUID comes from the shadow access token (the access token we get from cloud cache). We need to parse the access token and get the `puid` from it.

The shadow access token is a `JSON Web Token`(JWT) which means it is 3 base64 encoded strings concatenated by `.` and looks something like this: `aGVhZGVy.cGF5bG9hZA.c2lnbmF0dXJl` where the first string is the header, the second string is the payload, and the third string is the signature. The `header` and `payload` are both JSON and the signature is a hash of the header, payload, and a secret.

The `puid` is located in the `payload` so we must parse the JWT, get the payload JSON, and get the `puid`.

This is what Android is currently doing.

Testing:
1. Add gmail cc account (make sure it is not Hx)
2. Go to https://portal.aria.ms/
3. Go to the `iOutlook_Dev`
4. Open `Events` and select `account_lifecycle`
5. See that your gmail account is listed in there and that the `puid` field is filled out/not empty

title: Create initial settings page for privacy controls
description:
Add simple preferences page to allow toggling optional data and content, with placeholders for upcoming addition of primary account and enterprise vs consumer variance. Prevent sending optional events if permissions is not enabled. 

**Primary Reviewer:** @<84043D56-522F-4554-AF3D-ADD955DB8CCE> 

**Test Steps:**
1. enable Aria logcat
2. set logcat filter to 'aria' or 'AriaEventLogger'
3. navigate between mail and calendar tab, observe tab_component event is sent. (basically confirming behavior unchanged with feature flag off)
4. enable privacy settings feature flag
5. restart app
6. navigate between mail/calendar tabs. observe 'omitting optional event tab_component'
7. observe many other 'omitting optional event' logs. Don't worry about the specific events - many will end up as required in a future PR - this is just testing the mechanism for toggling them.
8. read a mail
9. observe mail_action event is created (i.e. you see Event name mail_action w/ properties instead of omitting). this confirms RequiredServiceData is sent when optional is disabled.
10. send a mail
11. observe send_message is created. this confirms RequiredDiagnosticData is sent when optional is disabled.
12. go to settings->preferences->privacy - permissions
13. enable optional data. you can also enable content analysis/downloading, but these have no functional behavior at this time.
14. navigate back to app
15. observe optional events which were previously omitted are now sent.


**Feature Flag(s):** 
privacySettings


**Todo:** 
lots more to do - this first PR is mostly to unblock work on the other moving pieces

title: OLMHxAccount: implement delete from all devices for Hx accounts
description:
Implement delete from all devices for Hx accounts as well as implement `OLMHxAccount.canDeleteAccountFromAllDevices` property.

After we de-provision the mail (this deletes the mailbox off of cloud cache), we must delete the account.

Testing:
1. Turn on `HxGoogleCloudCache`
2. Add Hx Gmail CC account
3. Go to settings -> account settings -> delete account -> delete from all devices
4. See that account is deleted
5. If you re-add account, you will not sync anything for 20 min since cloud cache will need 20 mins after de-provisioning to set up your mailbox again

title: Compose > Show loading UI from file selection
description:
Prior to this PR when receiving file(s) into compose, we may require loading their metadata (e.g. size, display name) in background. These are being done without a progress UI, and also without rotation support, since we assumed that it should be quick, which is no longer the case. For this reason, we also filter out "remote" file when firing implicit intent to launch system file picker, with the intention to have the slow download operation happening inside external apps.

This PR shifts metadata loading logic from ComposeRouter to ComposeComponent, where we rely on a new ViewModel for keep track of file selection that are still being processed, whose state will be observed by ComposeComponent to display progress UI accordingly.

As a result:
- we no longer need to filter out "remote" file when firing implicit intent for system file picker
- we no longer need to "confirm receiving Intent" from ComposeComponent. We would still need this confirmation mechanism in place in ComposeRouter, for the case when we're prompting for permission.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Select file(s) to attach from a device/external app
or Share from external app to compose
or Drop file(s) into compose
2. Should see a blocking Loading UI if it takes long for the selected files to show up, followed by normal attachment staging progress UI

**Unit Tests Added:** Yes

title: Samsung Emergency Mode - Error in running when selecting attachment while viewing meeting mail
description:
The issue was being observed when we try to open an email with a meeting file and try to email the attendees. Once we discard and come back to the mail list and then try to open the same email again, the meeting file was not rendering and clicking on the meeting area crashes the app.

There were 2 errors in this:
1. Meeting not rendering properly
2. Crash on click of meeting

For part-1: It has been handled the same way we handle across the app that if we fail to get meeting/event details, we close the window saying that couldn't find meeting/event details.

For part-2: The click was not handling the scenario if meetingInfo is null so required checks have been added.

■ Precondition : Emergency mode / Office 365 Account Login
■ Occurrence path: 
1. Outlook - Meeting mail viewer - Select the Attach Meeting file - scroll down - Email Attendees
2. Everyone - New message display - Keep touch the back key to move to the mail list
3. Review the same meeting mail

**Primary Reviewer:** @<A2877D82-0BFF-4A6F-B7DC-FD3596EBEDDA> @<F8622277-D92B-61C5-8D21-5625F964D4AD>  @<F4DA52B5-E946-63FC-B2C9-5AFA4A03F715> @<4B221264-CEBF-6B03-891B-9330C34EEF94> 

**Test Steps:**

2. Everyone - New message display - Keep touch the back key to move to the mail list
3. Review the same meeting mail

title: Fixing the app icon and updating to version 1.0
description:
The app icon had a grey border in some menus on the Tizen OS. The updated icon is the required size, with the proper circle cropping for it. 

Updating the app version to 1.0.0 in preparation of the announcement of the app. 

Fixed some UI refreshing when accounts were added/removed from the phone. The app will now navigate back to the "syncing" UI when all accounts are removed if previously there were some accounts. 

Added a popup after the user sends an email reply, to give feedback that the message was sent. The popup is displayed for 2 seconds if the user does not interact with the device, or gets dismissed on a tap of the popup.

title: Adding bezel support to the more option menu
description:
Even though the [Samsung documentation](https://developer.tizen.org/development/guides/native-application/user-interface/efl/ui-components/wearable-ui-components/more-option?langredirect=1) for the more option menu says that we do not need to call `eext_rotary_object_event_activated_set` when showing the menu to allow bezel support, it appears that we still do (and indeed the Samsung source code does the same thing). 

This change adds a call to the `eext_rotary_object_event_activated_set` API when showing the more option menu (to set it as the active object that wants bezel events), and again when the menu closes (to deactive the object).

Verified that both the mail list as well as the mail details more menu option lists support the bezel now.  

**Primary Reviewer:** @<4918FDFC-93AE-448C-B655-1A83522F80D2> @<840FC68B-4B25-683C-8C34-EC9A98282876>

title: Migrate AuthType to AuthenticationType to enable DirectSync in Hx
description:
Right now Android has multiple sets of account representations, between HxAccounts which are mapped to ACMailAccounts. And then there are Android system Accounts that may or may not map to those. We want to clean this up and refactor this to have a more unified solution, which will likely also be needed for DirectSync support.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<84043D56-522F-4554-AF3D-ADD955DB8CCE> @<AB4C2AF1-97A6-456D-9EB8-42DE8617DE16> @<2309118F-2E2B-6414-9F50-1291410C82EF> 

**Test Steps:**
1. LOGIN to the as many as accounts you can and try EVERY possible thing.

**Unit Tests Added:** No but will add

NOTE : ACMailAccount.getAuthType()/setAuthType() will be deprecated after merging this PR.

**Todo:**

- [x] Replace instances of AuthType in UTs
- [x] reAuth

description:
We need to add a tap-down state with the standard spec, which is just the same as the state when tapping `Cancel Event` button in calendar's Edit Event view.

Making SR cell fit its visible height is also included in this PR.

title: GoogleAuthController: Return access token from redeemGoogleAuthorizationCode for Hx Gmail CC
description:
HxCore did not return an access token in the actor `fetchGoogleAuthorizationCode` when it was first implemented. Now the actor `fetchGoogleAuthorizationCode` returns an access token. We can use the access token to get the user's profile now.

Flow:
1. User logs into their gmail account through the gmail website
2. The website returns an authorization code
3. Client passes authorization code to HxCore
4. HxCore uses the authorization code to get refresh and access token
5. Use access token to get user profile (this allows client to know if the user changed the email address when in gmail website when logging in)
6. Create account through `AccountManager.authenticate`

Testing:
1. Turn on `HxGoogleCloudCache` feature flag
2. Add random string @ gmail.com (for example: `qwerty@gmail.com`)
3. When on the gmail website/auth page, change the email address to the one you will log into
4. Sign in
5. Account should be added as the email address you changed to in step 3 instead of the random one in step 2

title: parity with existing string-based events
description:
- add fields to support matching the OWA Locations dashboard's data so our data can be incorporated and surfaced in a similar way.
- define the Thrift such that we have parity with existing string-based events defined in AnalyticsLocationActionsLogger
- add fields for save_new/save_edit and event_location_saved
- update text of generate script with words ending in 'ing' so it doesn't look like a command telling the user to do something

title: [iOS] Suggested reply: Account level control
description:
This PR is to realize the real-time account level control for suggested replies. Testing on iPad could better illustrate that the suggested replies' visibility changes right after toggle change in account settings.

The implementation consists of two parts:
1. Suggested replies toggle in account settings and its persistence
2. Corresponding UI change in conversation thread according to change of account settings through notification

Since the concept of feature flag is the same, I also made feature flag become real-time switch which is just the same as toggle in account settings.

description:
We need to properly set UIScrollView’s new iOS 13 attribute `automaticallyAdjustsScrollIndicatorInsets` as it's default value is `true` and it clashes with our custom logic.

https://developer.apple.com/documentation/uikit/uiscrollview/3198043-automaticallyadjustsscrollindica

title: Adds ability to preview more attachment types
description:
Previously, when choosing a file to attach to an email, we would only show the preview option in the bottom sheet that appears if it was a file we could open internally in Outlook. This change gives the option to preview any file that we know the phone has an app to open.

This change also adds the new icon for the preview option, and also correctly sentence-cases the options in the bottom sheet as pointed out by Claire.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<8A946417-8053-4C57-9349-4BF2333ADE6B> @<A4EA5658-F035-6C6F-94ED-709181CA75A4> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Add a storage/email account with a file type you couldn't preview before, but have an app on your phone that you can open it with
2. Start to compose an email
3. Tap the paperclip icon
4. Select 'Choose from files'
5. Tap the file and observe a bottom sheet with the preview option
6. Tapping the preview option should open the file in the third-party app

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):**
* Combined file picker

|---|---|

This pull request implemented a time zone search experience.

The feature is protected by the feature flag `composeMeetingTimeZone`. You can enable it if you want to give it a shot.

Currently, there's nothing to do when a time zone is selected. The intention is to wait the date localizer and keep the pull request small.

title: UI state restoration
description:
Set up basic UI restoration framework that can be used by other VCs.

In iOS 12, UI restoration from background to foreground is done by iOS. 
In iOS13, when we enable multi window, we need to handle the UI restoration ourself. 
This PR creates a basic flow to restore UI. We haven't implemented for all screens / flows in this PR yet, but plan to build on top of it as of following tasks.

- [x] More logging if needed
- [x] documentation around the framework use and purpose
- [x] linter rule to avoid regression or misuse (if there is way to do so for our use case) **[won't need this after API refactoring]**
- [x] clear NSUserActivity userInfo dictionary if app is relaunched after crash to avoid user getting stuck in a loop restoring the state.
- [x] Should we disable animation when VC's stack is restored to prevent user from seeing the stack creation **(won't fix in V1)**
- [x] add event and data flow architecture in wiki (separate PR for wiki updates ones we get the framework more robust) **won't fix here**
- [x] testing all restorable VC flows in multi window setup
- [x] Address FIXME's
- [x] Clear OLMStateRestorableCache during delete account, soft reset and other callbacks where we clear rest of our PinCache's 
- [x] Explore the option to turn on and off this feature using configurator 

**Adopting Restorable protocol**
Currently supported only for VC's deriving from BaseVC and BaseTabBarVC
1. create extension implementing Restorable protocol
2. Implement `saveUIState` and save any UI state that needs to be saved/restored using NSUserActivity and OLMStateRestorationCacheManager.

title: iOS 13/Accessibility: Update our accessibility labels to make it easier for VoiceOver users
description:
Our accessibility labels are verbose which makes it difficult to navigate in Voice Control.  To address this I made the label concise and I am using `accessibilityValue` and `accessibilityHint` to inform the user what the current selection is or what accounts are selected on the menu.  This makes it easier for VoiceControl users and provides the same experience for VoiceOver users as before.

In VoiceControl when you say "Show names" the OS will show labels over everything you can tap.

**Before**

![IMG_0041.PNG](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/bbac9a4f-19c9-4b12-9906-698499161b3d/pullRequests/323490/attachments/IMG_0041.PNG =50%x)![IMG_0040.PNG](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/bbac9a4f-19c9-4b12-9906-698499161b3d/pullRequests/323490/attachments/IMG_0040.PNG =50%x)

**After**

Now you can say "Tap menu", "Increment date 5 times", or "Tap expand" which is quite a bit easier than before where you needed to say something like "Tap show navigation pane".

![IMG_0046.PNG](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/bbac9a4f-19c9-4b12-9906-698499161b3d/pullRequests/323490/attachments/IMG_0046.PNG =50%x)

title: Show "Private" for local calendar events
description:
Show the "Private" switch on `EventDetailsFragment` for Local Calendar events.

The privacy setting value is computed from the following column:
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/CalendarContract.EventsColumns.html#ACCESS_LEVEL

Users cannot modify the value in this task. Since this would be a "read-only" attribute, we would want to do one of the following for the UI:
1. Keep using the "Private" switch widget, but disable it. We should still set its value though.
2. Replace the switch for Local Calendar events with an icon to show that the event is private. In Google Calendar, they only show an icon if the event is "private".

**Option 1 looks like:**
|Show More section not expanded|Show More section expanded|
|---|---|
|![private_in_show_more](https://ghe-us.microsoft.com/storage/user/2277/files/65f33b80-f050-11e9-9caa-24c9720ed845 =300x)|![private_expanded](https://ghe-us.microsoft.com/storage/user/2277/files/625fb480-f050-11e9-9a0e-e8b736f97660 =300x)|

title: [iOS][Answers] Build Bookmark Answer
description:
This PR adds support for the bookmark answer gated by a FF Bookmark Answer. This required a change to the Auth resource that was used to call 3S and adding scalable answerTypes. 

**Changes**
- Change Answers framework to retrieve token for correct resource
- Updated OLMDirectAnswer to support bookmark answer info
- Updated OLMDirectAnswer and SearchAnswerInfo to use a defined AnswerType based on EntityType and Intent from Answers response
- Add bookmarkAnswer cells for contact and link cells

title: Use dialog to show the list of incompatibilities in DraftEventActivity
description:
When the user switches stacks during event compose, there may be attributes some stacks support and others do not. The first example is that Local Calendar supports recurring daily events that last forever, while the other stacks do not.

There could be multiple incompatibilities, in this PR, we op up a dialog to list all the incompatibilities. There is only one potential incompatibility(**Recurrence Rule**) at the moment, but we may add more in the future.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<43C04179-FCDA-61C3-B0F6-A1DC2742566A> @<EF490E68-9367-6FD6-866C-38B37516F84F> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Step 1  Debug actions -> Feature flags management -> turn on `Local calendar write`
2. Step 2 Create a event with local calendar stack, set **repeat frequency** -> **Daily/Weekly**, set **until** -> **Forever**
3. Step 3 Back to DraftEventActivity, switch to non-local calendar stack, see the pop-up dialog

**Unit Tests Added:** <No>

**Feature Flag(s):** 
* Local calendar write

**Related PRs:**

title: Improves accessibility of editing do not disturb configurations
description:
The number picker control we use in our app for choosing times isn't accessible and can't be accessed via TalkBack; this PR makes sure editing do not disturb configurations is fully accessible. We achieve this by using the framework control for selecting the start and end times. 

Because the settings screen doesn't have separate UI points of entry for start time, end time and days of week, there was a need to create a dialog which is launched by selecting one of the config entries, to allow for editing the 3 variables.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<8F754161-F35F-451A-B03A-B90DC23DAE93> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Add an email account to the app
2. Enable TalkBack on your device
3. Navigate to the do not disturb settings page
4. Toggle work hours on, and then select the overall entry to launch the accessible dialog
5. Makes changes and observe that they are correctly saved
6. Repeat these steps for evenings

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):**
* Do not disturb refresh

title: Add support for multiple event reminders
description:
We don't support multiple event reminders for now, in this pull request we'll add multi event reminders support for local calendar.

**Changes:**
1. Add a class `NativeReminderRepositoryWrite` to support insert and delete reminders
2. Change method `setReminderInMinutes(int reminderInMinutes)` to `setReminderList(List<EventReminder> reminderList)` in `ComposeEventModel`
3. Add a method `alertInMinutesToEventReminder()` in `EventManager` to convert `reminderInMinutes` to `reminderList`
4. Replace `reminderInMinutes` to `reminderList` in `EventProperties` and `ComposeEventData`

title: Local calendar write > filter out declined events
description:
Based on design feedback, we will have consistent RSVP behavior across all calendar stacks including local calendars. If a local calendar event is RSVP declined by the user, then we will no longer show it in their calendar (similar to hx events).

This is possible by updating our event occurrence query to use the `SELF_ATTENDEE_STATUS != STATUS_CANCELED` filter. See https://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/CalendarContract.EventsColumns#SELF_ATTENDEE_STATUS 

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EF490E68-9367-6FD6-866C-38B37516F84F> @<7EDF895C-A065-65B6-8153-3601F2E81F77> @<38847B2E-17B2-69C9-AAD0-C483CD77B9E7> @<7086942D-435F-4EAA-A81E-FA5627BD9484> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Invite your local calendar account to an event (via a different account)
2. Decline the event via RSVP in outlook
3. Verify that the event is no longer shown in your calendar in outlook
4. RSVP accept or tentative to an event
5. Verify that the event is visible in your outlook calendar

title: Fix an issue when select recipient suggestion with external keyboard
description:
When selecting suggested recipients with keyboard, focus moves out of ContactsCompletionView. The focus change caused underlying ```TokenCompeteTextView.handleFocus``` called. After that, TokenSpanWatcher is lost. Thus, the TokenSpanWatcher.onSpanAdded is never called to update the done button status.

This change called ```requestFocus()``` to get the focus back when user select an autocomplete entry so that the TokenSpanWatcher will be added back through ```TokenCompeteTextView.handleFocus``` to solve the issue. 

**Primary Reviewer:** @<F8622277-D92B-61C5-8D21-5625F964D4AD> @<0AB917BA-D1F4-4FA6-B17F-8048E863E4FB> @<FA265C0C-4522-67AF-9480-F55952A7E4D2>

description:

2. click on last deeplink search in email 
3. it should redirect to search window with prefilled text "test"

possible cases -

1. search deeplink clicked with no account logged in
2. search query with account - ms-outlook://search?querytext=$QUERY&account=$EMAIL_ID
3. search query with incorrect or not logged in account - ms-outlook://search?querytext=$QUERY&account=$EMAIL_ID_NOT_LOGGED_IN
4. search query with empty account - ms-outlook://search?querytext=$QUERY&account=
5. search query with no account param - ms-outlook://search?querytext=$QUERY

expected output - 
1. open outlook app login page
2. open search page in outlook with query prepopulated and account pre-selected, load search result for that query in that specific account.
3. open search page in outlook with query prepopulated and account All account/Default one, load search result for that query in All account if multiple login or in default account if single account is logged in.
4. open search page in outlook with query prepopulated and account All account/Default one, load search result for that query in All account if multiple login or in default account if single account is logged in.
5. open search page in outlook with query prepopulated and account All account/Default one, load search result for that query in All account if multiple login or in default account if single account is logged in.
6. should refresh query and load new search result.

title: Fix silent errors when parsing RFC3339 strings
description:
When working with strings provided by Dropbox, our parser would sometimes fail silently and return absurd dates.
For example: `2013-08-25T18:09:27Z` would be parsed as the timestamp `190293213627000` (which is actually 8000/2/25 at 18:00:27 UTC). This would cause the Combined File Picker to show those items as the first row of the screen, before a header.

This PR switches from `Date` to `LocalDateTime` to parse the strings correctly.
Additionally, this PR updates the ranking logic for the combined file picker so that items with last modified dates pointing to a date in the future are ranked last.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<A4EA5658-F035-6C6F-94ED-709181CA75A4> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Step 1: Add a Dropbox account
2. Step 2: Navigate to the combined file picker, and validate that the dates shown for Recent files are correct (caveat: the Dropbox UI shows "client last modified" dates, and our UI shows "server last modified dates"). If the dates you see in the app are not the ones you'd expect, double-check the server date by querying the Dropbox API:

```
curl -X POST \
  https://api.dropbox.com/2/files/list_folder \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer ***your token***' \
  -H 'Cache-Control: no-cache' \
  -H 'Connection: keep-alive' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Host: api.dropbox.com' \
  -H 'cache-control: no-cache' \
  -d '{
    "path": "",
    "recursive": true,
    "include_media_info": true,
    "include_deleted": false,
    "include_has_explicit_shared_members": false,
    "include_mounted_folders": true,
    "include_non_downloadable_files": true
}'
```

**Unit Tests Added:** Yes

**Feature Flag(s):**
* `Combined File Picker`

title: Mimic composeV1's clipboard behavior
description:
This PR basically reverts https://office.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Mobile/_git/rooster-writer/pullrequest/338619, and work around the issue with another solution.

With PR, the clipboard behavior will be exactly the same as v1, it doesn't affect Android.

The root cause of #3660552 is that WebKit unable to retrieve URL from the `clipboardData`, my previous solution intercepts the paste event and inserts the text to DOM manually, but some spaces and linebreaks will be lost. (#3717678)

After investigating v1 carefully, I realized that PluginPastePlainText is fine, v1 is doing the same thing, and we have to translate URL to Text in the client, see `WebView.swift`.

title: Reduce send rate for Aria telemetry when app is in background
description:
Currently Aria uses the default REAL_TIME profile which sends outbound
data every few seconds, regardless of if the app is visible or not. We
now register a new BACKGROUND profile which sends every 12 hours and
toggle profiles when the app enters/leaves foreground.
    
Also add option to debug settings to enable Aria SDK debug logging so
internals can be observed.

Copy forked Aria SDK into our repo to support initialization with background profile. Related PR: https://msasg.visualstudio.com/Shared%20Data/_git/Aria.SDK.Java/pullrequest/1273439?_a=overview

**Primary Reviewer:** @<2108F300-2AB6-4F2F-BC9C-06B838BD629B> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Open debug->crash control
2. enable Aria SDK debug logging and Aria logcat
3. open debug->feature flags
4. enable ariaUseBackgroundProfile feature flag
5. create a log tag filter for `HTTPSENDER|AriaEventLogger`
6. use app (read a message)
7. notice AriaEventLogger generating app events
8. notice HTTPSENDER sending those events to the endpoint
9. put the app in background (go to home screen or open a different app)
10. notice periodic logs from AriaEventLogger (e.g. `powerlift_fetch_analysis_system` every 5 minutes). you can also send an email to yourself from another client to generate `notification_event`
11. notice those events do not trigger HTTPSENDER
12. bring the app into foreground
13. notice the events are now processed by HTTPSENDER
14. put the app into background
15. send yourself an email from another client (i.e. generate a `notification_event`)
16. wait 12 hours
17. observe HTTPSENDER sends the event after enough time passes in background. the timers are somewhat fuzzy, so it could be longer but it shouldn't be _more_ frequent than 12 hours after entering background mode.

**Feature Flag(s):** 
* ariaUseBackgroundProfile

title: Allowing the collection of watch logs when filing a shaker incident
description:
The main issue that is being solved is that issues people face on the watch can't be investigated unless the user brings the watch to a developer, developer unlocks it, and collects logs manually. This does not scale with more users than 2. 

The solution is to have the phone send a command to the watch to send over all log files that it has (today it is just the TXT log files, tomorrow it may be crash mini-dumps or crash callstacks). This is done by having the phone become the consumer of an accessory agent, and having the watch always spin up a provider agent. Then, when the user files a shaker, if the watch is running and alive, the logs will be copied over to the phone and uploaded after the powerlift incident is filed (similar to how partner teams upload logs like Intune, Authenticator or Company portal). 

The one caveat for this feature is that the watch app needs to be running at the time the phone sends the 'get logs' command. If it is not (and the agent could not be found) then the request will drop on the floor. The watch app can be running in the background for the request, but the process at least needs to be around. This should be fine because in most scenarios the watch app is kept around and is rarely terminated/closed. 

Example incidents:
[Example-1](https://dev-powerlift-gym.acompli.net/incidents?incident=b847d6c8-0189-4908-9be9-1b671225c7c1&installId=5vfjtcmaFQ)
[Example-2](https://dev-powerlift-gym.acompli.net/incidents?incident=707dc19d-9408-48fa-983f-fb067f0d65b1&installId=5vfjtcmaFQ)
[Example-3](https://dev-powerlift-gym.acompli.net/incidents?incident=31055009-6199-41c6-883e-54c2f63816d4&installId=5vfjtcmaFQ)


**Primary Reviewer:** @<4918FDFC-93AE-448C-B655-1A83522F80D2> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Deploy the app to a Samsung device with a galaxy wearable device paired to the phone.
2. Deploy the watch app to the wearable device as well. 
3. Launch the watch app and verify it shows the latest email messages that are also on the phone.
4. Launch the phone app.
5. File a shaker incident to trigger log uploads
6. Wait a bit for the watch logs to get copied and uploaded. 
7. View the powerlift incident page, and verify that there are "TizenOutlookWatchLog-*.log" files available. 

**Unit Tests Added:** No
