title: SplitVC: Hide UIPanelBorderView added on iOS 13
description:
On iOS 13, `UISplitVC` is refactored, with `UIPanelBorderView` (private class) added in its view hierarchy and 
This PR is to hide UIPanelBorderView on iOS 13.

### Code changes

1. On iOS 13, traverse `splitVC.view`'s subviews, find `UIPanelBorderView` and hide it.
2. Relayout `topDividerLine` because its height is incorrect at the very beginning.

title: 3617884  - Drag files (from ZeroQuery, Files list) into Compose or other apps
description:
With this implementation user can drag files from recent files in zero query as well as from files adapter.
Outlook Content provider's openFileMAM method  has been overridden to handle the drop in Compose.
Custom URI has been created to handle drag of a particular file.
getType will read this URI and gives out content type of file being dragged.
queryMAM will fetch display name and file size from URI
openFileMAM will call OLMDragAndDropManager to download that particular file.
Downloaded file will be provided to ComposeRouter which will add it on the compose body
OlmIdEncoderDecoder is being used to convert FileId to string and string back to fileId

**Primary Reviewer:** @<AB4C2AF1-97A6-456D-9EB8-42DE8617DE16> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Enable SupportDragFiles flag
2. Open Outlook in Dex mode
3. Open Zero query or Files Adapter 
4. Open Compose 
5. Long press on file to start dragging 
6. Drag it onto compose and drop it 
7. If it is an image it should be added in body as inline attachment else it should be added as an attachment 

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):** 
* supportsDragFiles
* supportsDragAttachments


**Todo:** 
- [x] Unit tests
- [x] Disable Files drag for protected accounts.
- [x] Test dropping on other supported apps. (Make it work if it is not working)
- [x] Work on ACIdEncoderDecoder For FileId conversion
- [x] Add support for all types of files (Currently Hx, Pop, Local and OneDrive are supported)

title: Fix shared mailbox show UPN instead of SMTP address

UPN != SMTP

We should always expose the user's SMTP address.

PASSWORD: Testing1

5. Observe the email address

title: change smime options layout to List for better accessibility talkback feature
description:
replaced LinearLayout with RecyclerView and removed secondary text.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<4B221264-CEBF-6B03-891B-9330C34EEF94> @<986CA9FA-79CD-65D1-87E6-19C5EF3A4E90> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Launch Outlook.
2. Login with hxsmime-1@hxsmimetest.onmicrosoft.com account. (Beta)
3. Go to outlook settings. Feature flags. App / Smime prototype master, turn to on 
4. Go to the HxCore tab, toggle "disableSMIMEdrafts" to off.
5. To enable S/MIME, go to the settings of the accounts above (account level settings, not app level) and tap on the security option. Toggle s/mime to "On".
6. Turn on the Talkback.
7. Go to the "Compose" button and activate it.
8. Fill all the details (To/CC/subject/message body) then navigate to the bottom bar (having attach meeting/ attach files/ take a photo/ more options).
9. Go to the "More options", activate it.
10. Navigate through the options (Sign / encrypt/ sign & encrypt) and listen to the Talkback's announcement.
After selecting one options, again go to the options (Sign / encrypt/ sign & encrypt) which is selected (again follow steps 3 & 4) and listen to the Talkback's announcement.
11. The talkback should announce the control type of the options in " Sign and encrypt " (Sign / encrypt/ sign & encrypt).  The control type to be button/List(Along with position)
12. The talkback should announce the selection state of the options (Sign / encrypt/ sign & encrypt).(Selected string to be announced)

**Screenshots:** 
|Before|After|
|---|---|
|![smime_2.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/330844/attachments/smime_2.png) |![smime5.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/330844/attachments/smime5%20(2).png) |

title: 3603686 - [Android] Can’t delete draft email from the Draft folder for IMAP , Exchange, Yahoo accounts
description:
For IMAP accounts we do not move drafts to trash folder on delete action, instead we permanently  delete them.
This type of accounts returns null when ```conversation.getMessage()``` is called. 
This PR adds a constructor to MailAction which accepts MessageId instead of message.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<AB4C2AF1-97A6-456D-9EB8-42DE8617DE16> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Add an IMAP account.
2. Create some drafts.
3. Try to delete these drafts.
4. Drafts should be deleted without any issue

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: 3613007 Integrate ActorAllowUserDataNetworkConnections HxActor for MIIT Variant
description:
In the case of MIIT builds, we block network calls at the HxCore level through the usage of the new HxCore.Initialize argument `waitForAllowUserDataNetworkConnections`, as the value of `VariantManager.shouldBlockNetworkAccess` until the user granted us network access. When the user grants us network access, we'll call AllowUserDataNetworkConnections actor.

In other builds (non MIIT), `VariantManager.shouldBlockNetworkAccess` is always false.

=> See that there is no network activity until you accept network access

=> See that everything is working as usual

title: Pre Download SMIME attachment before opening the Mail
description:
Currently, when an SMIME mail is opened the following happens - 1. The SMIME attachment is downloaded 2. The attachment is decrypted and 3) The body / actual attachments are extracted.

Unlike, other messages we do not Pre render SMIME messages and cache its body. This is because, we should not cache the body as the body should only be decrypted and visible if the user has proper certs and SMIME settings is enabled.

In this PR, instead of not doing anything for SMIME message, we are pre downloading the attachments in the same way we pre render and calculate the height of webview in MessageBodyRenderingManager. This will speed up showing up of SMIME messages in reading pane

**Primary Reviewer:** @<986CA9FA-79CD-65D1-87E6-19C5EF3A4E90> 
1. Send a heavy message with attachments and encrypt it.
2. Open the app with the message visible in message list and wait for sometime.
3. After that open the message. It should load comparatively faster. (Please note sometimes attachments might not have been completely downloaded in the previous step).

**Unit Tests Added:** NO

**Feature Flag(s):** 
Smime Prototype master

title: Localization: Remove incorrect Localized calls for watch
description:
Currently, we have several strings in the watch app that need localized. These would normally be localized by calling `NSLocalizedString("Some string", tableName: "WatchLocalizable", comment: "some comment")`. Instead of writing this out every time, a utility method was created:

```swift
func Localized(_ value: String, _ comment: String) -> String {
  return NSLocalizedString(value, tableName: "WatchLocalizable", comment: comment)
}
```

Now all you need to do is call `Localized("Some string", "some comment")` and it would return the localized string. 

However, this has a problem. The `.strings` files are generated by the `genstrings` tool, which basically uses regex to find calls to `NSLocalizedString`. Since there is only one in the watch, the one in the definition above, it finds it, but since it doesn't have a string literal in it, it's rejected (and ignored). 

By chance, since the function is named `Localized`, the tool which handles our standard calls to `Localized` found these and picked them up. These strings were never used though since they were in a different bundle. 

Some strings however were manually added to the file `WatchLocalizable.strings`. The call through `Localized` -> `NSLocalizedString` passed in the correct key for most of these, so they worked as expected. However, for those where the key was different, it did not match. 

This PR removes the custom `Localized` definition and replaces it with the `NSLocalizedString` call instead, making sure to specify the table manually. It also adds support for `WatchLocalizable.strings` in the autogeneration of strings files using `olm localize`.

title: Handle SMIME draft creation failure gracefully
description:
When Replying to a SMIME message, draft creation will fail if we are unable to decrypt the reference message. Decryption of reference message might fail if the user does not have certificates and is a valid scenario. Currently, if draft creation fails, we crash. However, draft creation might fail in valid circumstances for SMIME. Hence, in such circumstances, we show a dialog say the user does not have certs and draft cant be created.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<986CA9FA-79CD-65D1-87E6-19C5EF3A4E90> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Set up SMIME enabled account, but dont install certs.
2. Send an encrypted mail from some other account.
3. Try to reply to the mail.
4. You should see an error alert dialog.
5. Now, install certs and try to repeat above steps. Draft creation should succeed.

**Unit Tests Added:** Yes

**Feature Flag(s):** [Remove this section if n/a]
SMIME prototype master

title: Add support for notification obfuscation
description:
This feature is flagged under 
newHxEncryptionAPI - new Hx API for encryption and obfuscation (HxCoreDecryptor tryParseNotification)
mamNotificationSettings - new Intune APP (Application Protection Policy) for Notifications protection for both Mail and Calendar (includes TTL as well) and managed app config for calendar notifications override.

1. Deprecate FeatureFlag `mamBlockNotifications`
2. Consume new HxCore API for encryption and obfuscation
3. Save notifications policies in Settings bundle to make them accessible in NotificationServiceExtension
4. Retire below MDM notification policies (to make backward compatible, they trigger only when the new feature flags are disabled)
 
```
    static let mailNotificationsEnabled = "com.microsoft.outlook.Mail.NotificationsEnabled"
    static let mailNotificationsUserChangedAllowed = "com.microsoft.outlook.Mail.NotificationsEnabled.UserChangeAllowed"
    static let calendarNotificationsEnabled = "com.microsoft.outlook.Calendar.NotificationsEnabled"
    static let calendarNotificationsUserChangedAllowed = "com.microsoft.outlook.Calendar.NotificationsEnabled.UserChangeAllowed"
```
5. Wire notification settings for mail, calendar and TTL with new Intune policies and UI update for abbreviated notification interface

title: Adjust tab bar icons for ios 13
description:
The tab bar icons are not in the correct position for iOS 13 so I changed the image insets specifically for iOS 13 users. This is certainly not an ideal solution but I wanted to do a hot fix since Erin wanted it fixed ASAP.

I tried to make more of a dynamic solution but in iOS 13 and iOS 12 all the relevant properties seemed to be the same. I checked the frame for all the subViews of the tabBar, the tabBar safeAreaInsets, and the tabBar frame. Everything appeared to be the same even though the images are clearly in different positions. I'm wondering if there's some other properties I need to check or if I am checking them at the wrong time.

title: Adding a logging thread and file logger to the watch app
description:
These changes spin up a logging thread that logs all information to files on disk. Only debug and above is saved to disk (verbose was too chatty). The files are stored in the "cache" directory of the app, and can be pulled off using the SDB.exe tool. These changes also do a bit of cleanup (delete dead code, unused objects, and moving out of a 'C' file and into C++. 

Additionally, adding a new command protocol to allow the copying of the log files off of the watch device to the phone, so that the logs can be included in shaker incident reports. This is also done in the background logging thread by reading all of the "older" log files and sending them over the connection with the phone to be saved + uploaded. The watch now spins up a provider agent that the phone will look for when a shaker incident is filed. When responding, the watch will then send over each chunk of file to the phone. 

As log files are accumulated, they are aged off of the device by being deleted if older than two days. This pruning process happens on process launch, so we may need to add some heuristics to see if people don't fresh launch the process in a long time (we could prune after each new log file is created instead). 

Also in this change is a fix for the email ordering problem, in which the timestamp was not getting updated when a reply to an existing email thread was sync'd to the watch. 

App crashes are now tracked in a "crash" file, very similar to log files. When the app starts up, a crash-##.txt file is created (where ## is the current session value). If a crash ever happens in the app, the current callstack is output to the file before exiting the process. Then, when a shaker is filed on the phone, the crash files along with the log files are sent over to the phone to be uploaded for the incident. The crash files will have an age-out time of two weeks, while the log files will have two days.

title: Dark Mode: Fix is null exception in isMentionElement()
description:
As mentioned in #3589722, the composer will freeze while opening some drafts.

The root cause it that: some email drafts contain `<a>` tag without a href attribute like: `<a name="_MailOriginal">`. In this case, this will cause `Cannot read property 'toLowerCase' of null`:

```ts
const href = element.getAttribute("href").toLowerCase();
```

This issue can also be reproduced on the latest Android DEV.

We have recent change which now creates the file with it's display name rather than fileName created by Hx , But we were not using the display name for generating URI  to pass it to the activity accessing this - this causes a mismatch in URI for the file being downloaded and file being accessed.

description:
According to the current design decision: https://ghe-us.microsoft.com/outlook-mobile/iOS/issues/1143#issuecomment-322620, We follow the tapping animation design of Android.

The technical solution for this animation is to duplicate the visual part of the tapped cell as a UIView and animate this UIView. Not using snapshot is because snapshot cannot remain the cell's shadow.

Detailed parameters of this animation are generated from the discussion with Designer.

title: Upcoming events 1 - Add ViewModel for upcoming events
description:
We'll load events from database every two hours, then query upcoming events every minutes.

These events should be excluded:
- Events from interesting calendar
- Events from shared calendar
- Events from local calendar
- Events from calendar app
- Events not marked as "Busy" (Free, Tentative, OutOfOffice, Unknown)
- User is not the organizer of this event, and this events is not accepted (NoResponse, Tentative, Declined)
- Events from unselected calendar
- Events from read-only calendar
- All-day events

These are the rules of upcoming events:
- Show event which will be started in 30 minutes
- Hide event which started 6 minutes before
- Show newly arrived event which will start within 30 minutes or has started within 5 minutes
- Show/Hide events when a calendar is changed (unselected, removed, added)
- Recurring events should be displayed too

**Primary Reviewer:** @<0AB917BA-D1F4-4FA6-B17F-8048E863E4FB> @<EF490E68-9367-6FD6-866C-38B37516F84F> @<AB4C2AF1-97A6-456D-9EB8-42DE8617DE16>

description:

2. Send `upcoming_event_hidden` when the user dismisses an upcoming event
3. Log `upcoming_event_count` on `upcoming_event_new_event_in_window` with the total number of events in the window
4. Log `upcoming_event_new_event_in_window` when a new event is added to the data source
5. Log `upcoming_event_viewed` when an upcoming event is actually presented in the UI

title: Dark Mode: Fix AddressBookEditContactVC: Navigation bar while choosing ringtone for a contact
description:
Previous I did more 'hack' on `AddressBookEditContactVC` in order to support a fake navigation background for a dark version in !297879.
However, this 'hack' does not work well which choose the ring tone on this VC (#3519561).

## Code changes

- Revert !297879
- Implement theme overriding:
  - Add `UIColor` helper method: `public static func color(of color: UIColor, withTheme theme: Theme?) -> UIColor`
  - Add `ThemeOverridable`:
    ```swift
    public protocol ThemeOverridable {
      var overriddenTheme: Theme? { get set }
    }
    ```
  - Add support for `ThemeOverridable` on:
    - `BaseNavigationBar`
    - `TwoLinesTitleView`
    - `Hairline`
    - `DropdownMenuVC`
    - `DropdownMenuItemViewCell`
    - `DimmingView`
    - `DropdownMenuPresentationController`
    - `DropdownMenuVC`

title: Large Text: Schedule Message improvements
description:
Large text improvements for `ScheduleMessageShortcut`:

- Use self-sized `CardTableViewCell` instead because there can be possible two rows of labels if the text is large
  - If the text is large, put `textLabel` and `detailLabel` in difference rows.
  - If the text is normal or small, keep current layout calculation.
  - Since the number of cell rows should be constant (~6), it is less likely to have performance issue.
- Use dynamic text size in `DatePickerComponentTableViewCell`

title: invitees can propose a new time for a meeting invite
description:
Hx only

	Feature Flags
		proposeNewTime - enables the entire feature
		proposeNewTimeAnimateButtonEveryTime - makes the button animate every time you open the RSVP dialog

	General Feature Behavior: 
		When a user receives a meeting invitation, they can propose a new time (sometimes). The RSVP dialog displays a "propose new time" button which allows the user to suggest a new date and time. This is available from the message list or the calendar.

		"Propose New Time" flow appears for: 
			- non-recurring events
			- events that are exceptions of/to a recurrence (or single instances of a recurrence)

		"Propose New Time" flow does not appear for: 
			- recurring events
			- events for which the organizer has NOT requested responses

		The button will always be 'expanded' when there's a conflict.
		The button will normally be 'contracted', except for the first 2 times we display it (when there is no conflict). The first 2 times the button is displayed for non-conflicted invites, we expand-then-contract the button. You can make this animation occur every time by enabling the feature flag 'proposeNewTimeAnimateButtonEveryTime'.

	Test for accessibility: 
		without voiceover on, go to RSVP screen
		go to date/time picker, turn on voiceover, test behavior
		dismiss to RSVP screen
		go back in to consolidated voiceover date/time picker


	Notes:
		- we choose whether to show the button in MeetingRequestRsvpVC2 loadRsvpView based on MeetingInputContext's shouldShowPNTButton (from the extension on MeetingInputContext defined in MeetingRequestRsvpVC2)
		- we do not send message text when sending a time proposal

title: Contact Suggestion: Fix layout issue for regular size class
description:
Currently the layout for mention suggestion is incorrect for the cases of regular size class.

## Investigation

The logic padding used is in `ACTableView`, where the cell does not know whether it is 'narrow layout' in the `ConversationVC` or `ConversationThreadVC`.

## Changes

- Compute the width for `mentionsView` using `ContentMarginUtility`
- Set the `cellsLayoutType` property for `PeopleCell` into `.fullScreen` because we don't need left padding for it.
- Set the background color of `mentionsContainerView` into `.theme(light: .grey25, dark: .composeSurface)` because it fill the width of its parent

## Dependency check

- Mention suggestion
  - In `ConversationThreadVC` (quick reply)
  - In Compose
- Contact suggestion while composing email

title: SMIME App Config
description:
Here's the logic implemented.

com.microsoft.outlook.Mail.SMIMEEnabled will turn SMIME on or off. But if the user themselves turn SMIME on or off then the key will have no effect unless com.microsoft.outlook.Mail.SMIMEEnabled.UserChangeAllowed is false.

com.microsoft.outlook.Mail.OrganizeByThreadEnabled will turn message threading on or off unless SMIME is enabled, in which case message threading will be off.

The BlockExternalImagesEnabled key will be overridden to true if SMIME is on.

title: Share extension: Fix save/send for Hx account (except attachments scenario)
description:
This PR is based on top of the work in these 3 PRs:
- [enqueue save/send/delete operations in Rooster persistence controller](https://office.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Mobile/_git/client-cocoa/pullrequest/311545?_a=overview)
- [move attachments deduping/conversion logic to rooster persistence controller](https://office.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Mobile/_git/client-cocoa/pullrequest/312114?_a=overview)
- [move Rooster persistence controller to OutlookUI since 95% of its logic is non target dependent](https://office.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Mobile/_git/client-cocoa/pullrequest/312880?_a=overview)

Regarding this last mentioned PR, the 5% that differs between targets are the final-save and the send. The purpose of the current PR is to inject final-save and send controllers depending on the target.

Note that this PR doesn't fix saving/sending drafts with attachments. I will handle this in another PR since the changes are very independent.

title: Compose v2 > Fix always force compression
description:
Fix regression from !295058 where we don't take into account compression choice and always force compression if compressible.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9> @<43C04179-FCDA-61C3-B0F6-A1DC2742566A> 

**Test Steps:**
* Select multiple images (>1MB) to share to compose v2
* Choose original when prompted for compression
* Save as draft/send
* Draft/sent email should have original images

**Feature Flag(s):** composeV2a

title: Delete local calendar accounts when there are no mail accounts
description:
Adds an intent service to fire a background task when there are no mail accounts left in Settings. The bg task will check if there are any local calendar accounts, and if there are it will delete them. I verified no internet connection is required to delete as well.

See work item for repro steps: https://office.visualstudio.com/Outlook%20Mobile/_workitems/edit/3161856/

title: Local calendar write > allow the alert title to show if we have a single reminder
description:
Updating the alert UI in `EventDetailsFragment` for events if they support multiple reminders. Previously the title was not visible which would make the UI look confusing. Updated to show the title if we only have 1 event so that it is consistent with other stacks

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EF490E68-9367-6FD6-866C-38B37516F84F> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Open a local event with 1 reminder
2. Verify that the alert is shown as `<icon> Alert <alert-string>`
3. Open a local event with multiple reminders
4. Verify that the alert is shown as `<icon> <comma separated alert-strings>`

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: ComposeV2 - Only discard empty draft on finish
description:
This PR fixes a bug where empty drafts were being discarded if you pause the compose component. We should discard the empty draft when the component is finished, rather than when it is paused.

This fix also needed to save the 'isNewDraft' boolean to the compose bundle saved state, so that the correct state is restored when 'don't keep activities' is enabled.

Also added component methods for listening to `onBackPressed` events.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<A4EA5658-F035-6C6F-94ED-709181CA75A4> @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9> 

**Test Steps:**
* Open compose V2
* Attempt to attach a file
* Send the draft
* Verify that the draft has been sent
* Test with 'don't keep activities' enabled
* Test by pausing compose and resuming, then attempting to send a draft

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: Calendar: Changing Month title in Voiceover mode Scroll also
description:
Fixes #3162520 - Changing Month title in Voiceover mode Scroll too

None of the Drag and Scroll animation events for UIScrollView are
triggered when Voiceover is on and we use use the voiceOver next gesture.

So, now also checking if voiceover is On wherever animation was required
and also storing the current month contentOffset of the Scrollview in
ScrollViewDidScroll callback that gets called reliably, even when
voiceOver is on.
